[[File:Android 4.0.png|thumb|200px|Android 4.0, the operating system in the Galaxy Nexus]]
  â  
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] Googleâs previous flagship phones. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich"). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and Google's ''Nexus'' brands of Android smartphones.
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] Googleâs previous flagship phones. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich"). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and Google's ''Nexus'' brands of Android smartphones.

==Software==
==Software==
  +
[[File:Android 4.0.png|thumb|left|200px|[[Android (operating system)|Android]] 4.0, the operating system in the Galaxy Nexus]]
Galaxy Nexus is the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[Ice Cream Sandwich (operating system)|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]],<ref name="yahoo143600226">[http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]</ref> introducing a large number of new features and improvements including, but not limited to, Face Unlock,<ref name="bare_url">[http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/android-ice-cream-sandwich-adds-face-unlock-feature/ Android Ice Cream Sandwich adds Face Unlock feature - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> voice typing,<ref name="bare_url" /> Android Beam (using [[Near field communication|NFC]]),<ref name="bare_url" /><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/google-announces-nfc-based-android-beam-for-sharing-between-phon/ Google announces NFC-based Android Beam for sharing between phones (video) - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Wi-Fi Direct]]<ref name="bare_url" /> among others.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html |title=Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers |publisher=Developer.android.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
Galaxy Nexus is the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[Ice Cream Sandwich (operating system)|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]],<ref name="yahoo143600226">[http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]</ref> introducing a large number of new features and improvements including, but not limited to, Face Unlock,<ref name="bare_url">[http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/android-ice-cream-sandwich-adds-face-unlock-feature/ Android Ice Cream Sandwich adds Face Unlock feature - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> voice typing,<ref name="bare_url" /> Android Beam (using [[Near field communication|NFC]]),<ref name="bare_url" /><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/google-announces-nfc-based-android-beam-for-sharing-between-phon/ Google announces NFC-based Android Beam for sharing between phones (video) - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Wi-Fi Direct]]<ref name="bare_url" /> among others.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html |title=Android 4.0 Platform Highlights | Android Developers |publisher=Developer.android.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
